com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology

Interface IPhysicalTopology

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IDistributedApplicationRegistry
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IPhysicalTopologyMonitor, ITopologyMonitor
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPhysicalTopologyMonitor, AbstractStarTopologyMonitor, BcastTopologyMonitor, CentralizedTopologyMonitor, GaianNeighborOnlyTopologyMonitor, InternalPhysicalTopoMonitor, McastTopologyMonitor, PhysicalTopologyMonitorProxy, StarTopology, StarTopologyMonitor, TopologyMonitor

    public interface IPhysicalTopology
extends IDistributedApplicationRegistry

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Set<IApplicationDescriptor> getNeighborPeers(IApplicationDescriptor app)
      Get the list of peer applications that are immediate (one-link) neighbors with the same name space as that of the given app.
      IApplicationDescriptor getNextHop(IApplicationDescriptor src, IApplicationDescriptor dest)
      Get the next peer to connect to in order to reach the given destination peer.
      java.util.Set<IApplicationDescriptor> getReachablePeers(IApplicationDescriptor app)
      Get the list of reachable application peers (i.e., having the same name space as that given).
      java.util.Set<IApplicationDescriptor> getReachablePeers(IApplicationDescriptor app, int hops)
      Get the list of peers that are reachable within the given number of hops.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.ibm.watson.dsm.platform.topology.IDistributedApplicationRegistry

        clear, deregister, getRegistrations, isStarted, lookup, register, start, stop

    • Method Detail

      • getNeighborPeers

        java.util.Set<IApplicationDescriptor> getNeighborPeers(IApplicationDescriptor app)
        Get the list of peer applications that are immediate (one-link) neighbors with the same name space as that of the given app.
        Parameters:
        app -
        Returns:
        never null, but perhaps empty. The returned set does not include the given descriptor.

      • getReachablePeers

        java.util.Set<IApplicationDescriptor> getReachablePeers(IApplicationDescriptor app)
        Get the list of reachable application peers (i.e., having the same name space as that given).
        Parameters:
        app -
        Returns:
        never null, but perhaps empty. The returned set does not include the given descriptor.

      • getReachablePeers

        java.util.Set<IApplicationDescriptor> getReachablePeers(IApplicationDescriptor app,
                                                      int hops)
        Get the list of peers that are reachable within the given number of hops.
        Parameters:
        app -
        hops - the number of network links to traverse. 0 or larger, where 0 means peers on the same host (i.e. without a hop between NICs).
        Returns:
        never null, but perhaps empty. The returned set does not include the given descriptor.

      • getNextHop

        IApplicationDescriptor getNextHop(IApplicationDescriptor src,
                                IApplicationDescriptor dest)
        Get the next peer to connect to in order to reach the given destination peer.

        TODO: can we get rid of src parameter?

        Parameters:
        src -
        dest -
        Returns:
        null if no path exists.
